poem:
**Street Symphony**

In the hum of Brixton's heart,  
a DJ spins the sun,  
and voices arc like meteors:  
Daddy Freddy takes the mic,  
unrehearsed, a cosmic chance.  
Strangers gather, pixels hum,  
and music unlocks the everyday—  
an ordinary miracle,  
alive in bits and beats,  
as London sways  
to an open-air universe.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘The most important DJ in the UK’? Live streamer takes music to streets DJ AG knew he was on to something after Daddy Freddy’s performance. The DJ, real name Ashley Gordon, has garnered more than 385,000 followers by doing something incredibly simple: playing music outside and allowing people to perform alongside him while he livestreams the results. When Daddy Freddy approached him in Brixton, he did not know the man who picked up the mic". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘The most important DJ in the UK’? Live streamer takes music to streets DJ AG knew he was on to something after Daddy Freddy’s performance. The DJ, real name Ashley Gordon, has garnered more than 385,000 followers by doing something incredibly simple: playing music outside and allowing people to perform alongside him while he livestreams the results. When Daddy Freddy approached him in Brixton, he did not know the man who picked up the mic
